terms.definition: Printed Circuit Board - the electronic foundation that connects and supports electronic components in devices
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or files over time, allowing users to revert to previous versions and compare iterations
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted online and accessed via web browsers
A single, unified location where all project files, documents, and resources are stored and managed for easy access by team members
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously work on, edit, and comment on documents with changes visible instantly to all participants
Software or services that are hosted on remote servers and accessed via the internet rather than installed locally on individual computers
The systematic monitoring and management of regulatory requirements, certifications, and industry standards documentation
Industry standards developed by the Association Connecting Electronics Industries that govern PCB design, manufacturing, and assembly processes
Detailed technical drawings that show the electrical connections and components of a circuit using standardized symbols
Groups of people with different functional expertise working together toward a common goal, such as engineers, designers, and manufacturers
Detailed written materials that explain how to use, maintain, or understand technical products, processes, or systems
Pre-designed document formats that ensure consistency and reduce errors by providing a uniform structure for similar types of content
Access control features that determine which users can view, edit, or share specific documents or sections of a platform
The systematic approach to tracking, reviewing, and implementing modifications to documents or systems while maintaining version history
